strangle.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to kill someone by pressing their throat with your hands, a rope etc
strangle.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The victim had been strangled with a belt.
strangle.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to limit or prevent the growth or development of something
strangle.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Mills argues that high taxation strangles the economy.
strangle.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The strangle would be profitable if the stock price moves out of the 372p-444p range before expiry of the options on Nov 19.
